p: Illumina sequencing yielded on average 67 million paired‐end reads, of which 62 million remained after trimming (Supporting Information Table S1). A combined assembly with Trinity produced 753,305 contigs ( N 50 = 2,025 bp) which was reduced to 648,465 ( N 50 = 1,614 bp) after clustering at 98% identity. Of this clustered set of contigs, 26% contained open reading frames (ORFs; Supporting Information Table S1) and between 80% and 90% of reads aligned to this clustered contig set which were then used for differential expression analysis (Supporting Information Table S2). Annotations from SwissProt revealed information for ~20% of the clustered contigs while KEGG provided assignments to 18% (Supporting Information Table S3).
